physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Unremarkable physical examination; blood tests within normal limits; no eosinophilia (absolute eosinophil count, 90 eosinophils/mm3); findings of urinalysis were normal, but analysis of a 5-h urine collection revealed S. haematobium eggs.
At a urologic clinic, an enlarged and slightly tender prostate was identified; transrectal ultrasound showed enlarged prostate; biopsy revealed S. haematobium eggs.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At follow-up, the size of the prostate returned to normal.
